poem:
### The Listening Wind

In wires, whispers weave,
silent thefts of speech
by the night's unseen artisans.
Voices float,
devoid of flesh,
across an expanse of
impersonal glass.
We are heard, yet unheard,
our secrets bartered for shadows—
the unseen sentinels
who have long since forgotten
the warmth of our words.
